bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Born in Norfolk, Virginia, in 1841 to John H. Sale (b. ca. 1819) and Lucy L. Sale (ca. 1820-1894), John F. Sale had begun a career as a carpenter when the Civil War started. Sale enlisted 17 May 1861 in the 12th Virginia Infantry, serving in several of its campaigns. Originally a private, he rose through the ranks, finally becoming a lieutenant 22 November 1864. Mortally wounded at Hatcher's Run, Virginia, on 6 February 1865, Sale died in Petersburg, Virginia 12 February 1865.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1861-1865, of John F. Sale (1841-1865) of Norfolk, Virginia, consisting mainly of correspondence from Sale, while serving in the 12th Virginia Infantry, to his family in Norfolk during the Civil War. The letters detail Sale's service and experiences during the war. Also contains correspondence from family members concerning Sale's death. Also includes Sale's diary from 4 May 1864 to 31 January 1865 and an obituary of Sale. Also includes letter, 31 August 1864, from an unknown writer describing fighting between Confederate and Union forces in the Shenandoah Valley in August 1864.
